definitions: having a coat color that mixes reddish-brown and gray or white hairs, typically seen in horses
examples: The roan horse stood out among the dark ones
She chose a beautiful roan mare for riding lessons

definitions: producing a deep, loud, continuous sound like that of a lion or engine
extremely successful, busy, or lively in a way that suggests energy and prosperity
examples: The roaring engine drowned out their conversation completely
We sat by the roaring fire on cold nights
Business was roaring after the new product launch
The restaurant did a roaring trade during holidays

definitions: prepared by cooking with dry heat in an oven or over fire
examples: The roast chicken filled the kitchen with aroma
We ordered roast vegetables as a side dish

definitions: prepared by cooking in an oven or over fire until browned and cooked through
subjected to severe criticism or mockery in a harsh but often humorous way
examples: The roasted almonds made a perfect healthy snack
She served roasted potatoes with herbs and garlic
The comedian got roasted by his fellow performers
Critics roasted the movie for its poor plot

definitions: dressed in or covered with a long, loose outer garment or ceremonial clothing
examples: The robed figures walked silently through the monastery
Judges entered the courtroom robed in black gowns

definitions: moving or acting in a stiff, mechanical way without emotion or natural human expression
relating to or characteristic of robots or their design and operation in technology
examples: His robotic movements suggested he was extremely nervous
She spoke in a robotic voice without any feeling
The factory uses robotic arms for precise assembly
Students learned robotic programming in computer class

definitions: showing strong health, vigor, and constitution in body or mind
able to withstand difficult conditions or rough handling without breaking or failing
examples: The robust athlete competed in multiple events daily
Children need robust immune systems to fight infections
The software has a robust security system installed
We need robust furniture for the busy restaurant

definitions: containing many rocks or consisting of rock material on the surface
characterized by difficulties, instability, or problems that make progress challenging
examples: The rocky coastline made swimming dangerous for visitors
Hikers struggled along the rocky mountain trail path
Their rocky relationship finally ended after two years
The company faced a rocky start in its first year

definitions: characterized by elaborate ornamentation, curved lines, and pastel colors typical of 18th-century European art
examples: The rococo palace featured gold leaf and painted ceilings
She decorated her room in rococo style with mirrors

definitions: shaped into a cylindrical form by turning over and over on itself
made flat or smooth by pressing with a roller or similar tool
examples: The rolled newspaper fit perfectly through the mail slot
She served rolled sandwiches cut into pinwheel shapes
The baker used rolled dough for the pie crust
Workers laid rolled steel sheets for the roof

definitions: exuberantly lively and amusing in a way that involves energetic fun and enjoyment
examples: The rollicking party lasted until dawn with music
Children enjoyed the rollicking adventure story before bedtime

definitions: having a roof or covered with a structure that protects from weather above
examples: The newly roofed building protected equipment from rain
They built a roofed pavilion for outdoor gatherings

definitions: lacking a roof or having no covering structure on top for protection
examples: The roofless ruins showed centuries of weather damage
After the tornado, many houses stood roofless and exposed

definitions: firmly established or ingrained in a particular place, tradition, or belief system
having roots that have grown into soil or being fixed by roots
examples: Her values were rooted in family traditions and culture
The conflict was rooted in historical disagreements
The rooted plants survived the drought better than seedlings
Ancient trees stood rooted for hundreds of years

definitions: having a pink or reddish color like that of a rose flower
characterized by optimism, hope, or a positive outlook about future events
examples: Her rosy cheeks showed she'd been outside exercising
The sunset painted rosy colors across the sky
He painted a rosy picture of the company's future
Despite problems, she maintained a rosy outlook on life

definitions: moving in a circle around a central point or axis in mechanical operation
examples: The rotary engine design improved fuel efficiency significantly
She used a rotary phone from her grandmother's era

definitions: turned or caused to turn around a center point or axis in circular motion
examples: The rotated image needed adjustment to display correctly
Crops were rotated annually to maintain soil health

definitions: relating to or characterized by movement around an axis or taking turns in sequence
examples: The planet's rotational speed determines its day length
Employees work on a rotational schedule including weekends

definitions: decomposed through bacterial or fungal action, becoming soft, dark, and unusable
examples: The rotted wood needed immediate replacement for safety
Rotted fruit attracted flies to the garbage bin

definitions: decomposed and foul-smelling due to bacterial action on organic matter
morally bad, dishonest, or corrupt in character or behavior
extremely unpleasant, inadequate, or of very poor quality
examples: The rotten eggs produced a terrible smell when broken
She threw away the rotten vegetables from the refrigerator
The rotten politician finally got caught taking bribes
Corruption had created a rotten system needing reform
I had a rotten day at work with everything going wrong
The weather has been rotten all week long

definitions: not following a direct route or method but taking a longer, indirect way
examples: He gave a roundabout answer to avoid the truth
We took a roundabout route to see the countryside

definitions: having a smooth curved shape without sharp angles or corners
having a variety of aspects that create completeness and balance
examples: The rounded edges made the table safer for children
She drew perfectly rounded circles for the design
He received a rounded education in arts and sciences
The program offers rounded development for young athletes

definitions: somewhat round in shape but not perfectly circular or spherical
examples: The roundish stones made an interesting garden border
She had a pleasant roundish face with dimples

definitions: exciting and inspiring strong feelings of enthusiasm, energy, or determination
examples: The coach gave a rousing speech before the game
The crowd sang rousing patriotic songs at the rally

definitions: moving from place to place without a fixed destination or settled home
examples: The roving reporter covered stories across three continents
Roving bands of musicians performed at various venues

definitions: behaving in a noisy, rough, and uncontrolled way that disturbs others
examples: The rowdy crowd required extra security at the concert
Teachers struggled to control the rowdy students after recess

definitions: made from or consisting of elastic material obtained from trees or produced synthetically
examples: She wore rubber gloves while washing the dishes
The rubber tires provided good traction on wet roads

definitions: having a texture or consistency similar to rubber, often tough and elastic
examples: The overcooked eggs had a rubbery texture nobody liked
His rubbery legs could barely support him after running

definitions: having the deep red color characteristic of the precious ruby gemstone
examples: She wore ruby lipstick to match her dress
The wine had a beautiful ruby color in the glass

definitions: having a healthy reddish color, especially in the face from good health or outdoor activity
examples: His ruddy complexion showed years of outdoor work
The ruddy glow of sunset filled the western sky

definitions: involving or limited to basic principles, not developed beyond an elementary stage
examples: Students learned rudimentary skills before advancing to complex techniques
The shelter provided only rudimentary protection from storms

definitions: having a disturbed smooth surface with gathered folds or wrinkles
emotionally disturbed, annoyed, or made to lose composure by something
examples: The bird's ruffled feathers showed it felt threatened
She smoothed her ruffled dress after sitting down
He seemed ruffled by the unexpected criticism at work
Nothing ruffled her calm demeanor during the crisis

definitions: having a rough, irregular surface or outline characteristic of rocky terrain
strong and tough enough to withstand difficult conditions or rough treatment
examples: The rugged coastline attracted adventurous hikers and climbers
They drove carefully over the rugged mountain roads
His rugged face showed years of outdoor experience
The phone's rugged design survived multiple drops

definitions: reduced to a state of decay, collapse, or uselessness through damage or neglect
examples: The ruined castle attracted tourists interested in history
Heavy rain ruined their outdoor wedding reception plans

definitions: causing or likely to cause complete destruction, downfall, or financial disaster
examples: The ruinous policies led to economic collapse nationwide
Years of ruinous spending habits destroyed their savings

definitions: marked with straight parallel lines for writing or measurement
controlled or governed by a person, law, or principle with authority
examples: Students wrote neatly on ruled paper during exams
The ruled notebook helped keep handwriting straight
The country was ruled by democratic principles and laws
She ruled the department with fairness and efficiency

definitions: peculiar, strange, or odd in a way that seems suspicious or difficult to understand
examples: That's a rum way to solve the problem
He gave me a rum look when I asked

definitions: making a continuous deep sound like distant thunder or heavy traffic
examples: The rumbling thunder warned of an approaching storm
His rumbling stomach indicated he needed lunch soon

definitions: odd, strange, or peculiar in appearance or character, similar to 'rum'
examples: He had a rummy feeling about the whole situation
The old house had a rummy smell nobody could identify

definitions: happening or done quickly and uncontrollably, impossible to stop or manage
having run away from home, an institution, or responsibilities
examples: Runaway inflation destroyed the country's economy within months
The runaway train sped downhill without working brakes
The shelter helped runaway teenagers find safe housing
Police searched for the runaway horse in nearby fields

definitions: relating to or written in ancient Germanic alphabet characters used for inscriptions and magic
examples: The runic inscriptions on the stone puzzled archaeologists
She studied runic symbols found in Viking settlements

definitions: done or completed too quickly without proper care or attention to detail
examples: The rushed job showed many careless mistakes throughout
She gave a rushed apology before leaving abruptly

definitions: having a reddish-brown color like autumn leaves or certain apple varieties
examples: The russet potatoes made excellent baked potato dishes
Autumn painted the leaves in russet and gold

definitions: having the reddish-brown color of iron oxide formed by corrosion
examples: She chose a rust sweater to match autumn colors
The rust paint complemented the earth-tone decorating scheme

definitions: covered with or damaged by rust through oxidation of iron or steel
examples: The rusted gate squeaked loudly when opened slowly
Rusted tools lay forgotten in the old shed

definitions: having the simple, artless qualities associated with countryside or rural life rather than cities
examples: The rustic cabin provided a peaceful weekend retreat
Guests enjoyed the restaurant's rustic charm and atmosphere

definitions: making a soft crackling sound like dry leaves or paper being moved
examples: The rustling leaves warned of approaching footsteps nearby
She heard rustling sounds coming from the attic

definitions: covered with rust or having the reddish-brown color of rust
impaired in quality or fluency through lack of recent practice or use
examples: The rusty old bicycle needed oil and new parts
Rusty metal flakes fell from the aging bridge
My French is rusty after years without practice
His rusty golf swing improved after several lessons

definitions: showing no mercy or compassion, willing to achieve goals regardless of harm to others
examples: The ruthless dictator eliminated all political opponents swiftly
Her ruthless business tactics destroyed smaller competitors

definitions: relating to a period of paid leave for study or travel, traditionally every seventh year
examples: She took a sabbatical year to write her book
The professor's sabbatical leave lasted two full semesters
